name: Kenneth Gärdestad
description: '''John Charles Kenneth Gärdestad''' (9 May 1948 – 3 March 2018) was a Swedish songwriter, best known for writing lyrics for the songs of his brother, [[Ted Gärdestad]]. He participated at [[Melodifestivalen 1979]] as a songwriter for the winning song "[[Satellit]]" performed by his brother. The song went on to [[Eurovision Song Contest 1979|Eurovision]] the same year, where it placed 17th. Gärdestad was also an architect, affiliated to the private [[Kunskapsskolan]], where he designed the interior of several of its high schools. Gärdestad published the biography ''Jag vill ha en egen måne'' in 2005. In later years he became a mental health activist, and created the "Ted Gärdestad Stipend", a prize awarded to amateur singers and songwriter.
